column2: The best enterprise-grade WYSIWYG editor. Fully customizable with countless features and plugins.

Model API for dialogs (#2488)

Model API for dialogs

Co-authored-by: Jacek Bogda≈Ñski <jacekbogd@gmail.com>
Ignore manual tests in unsupported environments.
Updated tableselection dialog model tests with cell properties.

Duplication call removal.

Co-Authored-By: Tomasz Jakut <vepomoc@gmail.com>
openDialog is able to force dialog model.
Table is only in editing mode for 'tableProperties' dialog.
Removed redundant manual test (moved into concrete plugin.
Refactored manual tests to use model editing dialog helper.
Extracted dialog editing mode manual test code initialization.
Added dialog tag to simplify testing.
Updated tabletools plugin with getData member implementation.
Updated image plugin with getModel member implementation.
Updated flash plugin with getData member implementation.
Fixed issue with invalid hidden element.
Updated forms plugin dialogs with getModel member implementation.
Simplified table getModel, added manual test.
Added small test coverage for liststyle.
Added manual test for link and anchor.
Added tests, removed redundant private getter.
Updated case where element may be in detached mode.
Removed event based editing mode verification.
Removed editor argument from setModel method.
Integrated dialog model API in list style dialog. Also adjusted manual test.
Integrated dialog model API in Easy Image plugin.

Removed dialogCreated event and added dialog instance to the dialogDefinition event. Also corrected API docs for the event.

Same thing could be achieved reusing dialogDefinition event.
Added extra manual test, integrated anchor with dialog model API.

Restored big old constructor for CKEDITOR.dialog.

I'm doing that to reduce the amount of changes.

Initial model implementation for link dialog.

Ideally I'd like to see it implemented in a way that it stores the array of links. Just like _.selectedElements does in the dialog.
Tests: added checks for editing mode.
Tests: unit tests for link and dialog model integration.

Tests: improved DRY factor.

Instead of creating each TC with copy and paste it make sense to reuse bender.tools.createTestsForEditors method.
Refactoring: removed old dialog model handling.

Modified the API proposal. Allow the model to passed in editor.openDialog call directly.

This will allow to set the model before calling dialog.show() method. Technically it could even be passed to the dialog constructor, however I don't think there will be a need to do that.

Temporarily I added model as an extra parameter in editor.openDialog - later on I'll turn the second argument of editor.openDialog into an object.

I can see now that there's a room for simplifying the change of this branch, which I'll do in subsequent commits.
Added tests for dialog.isEditing and widget integration.

Made the editor.openDialog API compatible with old approach.

The difference is that old API executed the callback after the dialog data was initialized and the dialog DOM was prepared. This change will do the trick.

There's no more a need to use custom getModel for placeholder dialog.

Now it works out of the box for any widget-based dialog, fully backward compatible.

Second approach, this seems to be working much better.

Still not perfect, but slowly I'm getting to a point where it does look nice. Reverted most of changes from widget plugin (vs major branch).

Refactoring: extracted dialog's initial render logic into a method. And no - I'm not going to touch this code for the time being üòâ

The idea is to delay actual render as late as possible. Only a couple of _renderDialog() calls have been added and a helper flag to control whether the content has been already rendered.

Initial attempt to reuse dialogCreated event in widget plugin.

Doesn't look too good. It's hard to pass the "in-memory" widget in case of adding a new one, without resorting to global variable trickery.

Now dialog initially emits getModel event if model can not be obtained.

Current implementation become redundant as getModel and _determineModel serve similar purpose - that will be changed. However the biggest issue is that getModel event is emitted way too late, it should be fired at the beginning of the constructor, before any field-related logic kicks in.
Refactored unit tests. Reduced the amount of try/catch/finally blocks, instead always hide the dialog in tearDown function.

Making getModel() work with widgets requires some state tossing.

This doesn't look to good and looks that we'll have to find another solution for widget case.
Placeholder dialog uses now getModel() function.
Adjusted couple of table dialog setup functions to use getModel() method rather than custom implementation.
Make sure getModel() passes the editor parameter.
Changed the way how default getModel method is implemented.
Make sure dialogs do have default getModel() method.If we didn't provide the default implementation it would require a lot of duck typing.
Docs: drafted API docs for the CKEDITOR.dialog.modeledDialog interface.

Removed code which is redundant after changes.

Reworked how dialog is styled.
Dialog wrapper now has fixed position with width and height set to 100%.
When dialog is shown body gets class with 'overflow:hidden', and right padding calculated from width of scrollbar.
In all browsers dialog is centered with only CSS. In IE it is centered via absolute position calculated by script.
When dialog is is dragged it becomes absolute positioned.

Merge pull request #1420 from ckeditor/t/586

Fixed required attribute not being correctly recognized by form dialog
Changed requried attributes to various values
Refactored tests by extracting similar code to _helpers/
Moved duplicate code to private helper function

Fix selection of `required` checkbox in forms plugin

- according to HTML spec, valid values for the attribute are:
  - no value at all
  - empty string (required="")
  - string `required` (required="required")
- with the current implementation, the checkbox is checked,
  if the attribute contains any value
  -> if there is no value or an empty string, the checkbox
     is not selected, which is wrong
  -> if there is a value other than "required", the checkbox
     is selected, which is wrong
- see ticket #14291

Refactored easy image plugin to utilize upload feature to upload files upon widget initialization.

Previously easy image had a custom implementation for that, where it would handle dispatching widget upload. Since I had to implement it in upload feature core (to support cutting/copying the widget or drag and drop integration) it make sense to reuse what is already in the core.

Tests: ignore unsupported environments in upload widget feature / progress bar tests.

Also spotted two minor CSS code style issues, fixed it together.
Tests: added manual test for progress bar being displayed with right-to-left languages.
Renamed last remaining "progress indicator" into "progress reporter" which sounds much better for a generic class.
Docs: added an API listing for ProgressBar constructor.

Major API change in ProgressReporter types: removed static createForElement(), progress bar is now stored directly in the widget wrapper (so that it doesnt leak to output).

First: static createForElement() was not really a greatest idea in terms of DX. When extending the ProgressReporter type it required to reimplement it - mostly without any change other than changing the returned type. Instead one should simply create it using constructor, and then manually put the wrapper where they see it fit.
Second: Placing inside a wrapper rather than element makes more sense, so it's being placed where the widget "guts" are. However this caused some styling issues it looks like people implementing the progress bars will have to pay attention to styling.
Tests: added a manual test for Upload Widget Feature.
Fixed an issue where failed upload would remove widget partially. Also improved docs and tests.
Fixed a case where it would be possible to trigger Upload Widget Feature by dropping onto readonly editor.
Tests: added an integration test for switching editor mode during Easy Image upload.
Moved widget upload feature progress logic back to imagebase. Improved test coverage.
Docs: added API docs for uploadFailed event.
Tests: minor code style adjustments in upload feature suite.
Added more unit tests for Upload Widget Feature.
Added basic tests for Upload Widget Feature.

Explicitly marked widget name in it's definition object.

This is done as a temp workaround, as the objects that we're passing as definition to features, are copies of the original definition. In other words any modifications to definition done at runtime (by other features setUps or at a widget runtime) are not available in setUp function. Because of that definition.name was not available (because it's assigned by the widget system at a widget construction time).
Added a base ProgressReporter type, refactored code to use it properly. Adjusted API docs.

Merge pull request #1195 from ckeditor/t/933-2996

Inline toolbar context feature

Removed an extra fallback logic for highlightElement, as now it's impossible for it not to be an element.

Since it's guaranteed by https://github.com/ckeditor/ckeditor-dev/blob/e382734/plugins/inlinetoolbar/plugin.js#L425-L428 (it's the only place where contextMached is set).
Refactoring: simplified matching logic in Context Manager.
Tests: added extra unit test ensuring that subsequent false matches will not reset last previously returned (correct) pointed element.
Tests: used more precise assertions for type checking.
Ensure that _matchRefresh returns null if nothing was not matched.
Unit test checking return type of '_matchRefresh'.
Refactoring: _matchRefresh will now return element or null and no longer a bool value. Added an extra TC that was not covered before.
Refactoring: _matchElement and _matchWidget can now return either element or null. No booleans anymore.
Improved docs for inline toolbar context.
Docs: corrected API docs for _matchWidget method.
Tests: added more cases for CSS matching.
Tests: added links to a manual test.
Tests: reused shared assertion in one more test suite.
Tests: fixed inline toolbar context unit test failing on Safari, reused helper methods.
Extracted common _assertToolbarVisible assertion to a helper file.

Tests: removed unused inline toolbar context method.

Notes: Actually I had to remove it as this test didn't have sense anymore.

It assumed that options.widget will take effect if the selection is within nested editable, say a strong (and this case is covered with unit test in widget.js).

However after research we have implemented it in a way that options.widget takes effect only when the widget itself is focused.
Fixed a typo in a method name.
Docs: docs corrections, added missing method descriptions.
Ignored IE8 in tests. Added a logic that will make sure that plugin does not explode when loaded in IE8.
tests: added a fancy global editor toolbar imitation using inline toolbar.
Applied last API change in manual tests.

Refactoring: moved inline toolbar create, and related members to editor.inlineToolbar namespace.

Former solution of putting it in editor.plugins.inlinetoolbar felt wrong during APi review.
Fixed case where inline toolbar would throw an exception given invalid button name.
Tests: added unit test for case when invalid button names are passed to inline toolbar configuration.
Fixed a case where highlight element from previous context match might be used for a future context match.
Tests: added test case for invalid highlighted elements.
Docs: improved API docs, by introducing abstract CKEDITOR.plugins.inlinetoolbar.contextDefinition type.
Docs: added missing private doc tags.
Docs: corrected param name in _matchElements method.
Docs: Updated name of a method.
Changed ACF-based options.elements to CSS-based options.cssSelector.

The default selection used by inline toolbar context manager is now shrunk to work with inner-most element.

See previous commit message for more info on that.

Tests: added unit test for shrinking selection when probing context menu.

Reason for this is that some of our code will select whole element after it was changed. For instance link plugin, as you edit the link it will put the selection outside of a link element.
Corrected element pointed by the inline toolbar after matching a widget.
Tests: added manual test for widgets.
Test: updated manual test for context, added second, more complex manual test.
Use real visibility checks for assertions, rather than probing hide/show methods.

Giving a try to ContextManager class - basic interface so far.

It became clear that contexts will need some sort of manager in order to implement prioritized checks. Currently checking logic is implemented in the Context.refresh method - but the problem is that it makes all three checks at once.

Instead we need to do only highest priority checks (options.refresh) on each active context. If none matched, then we move on to second priority matching, which is widget - and so on.
Tests: added a test to check whether options.elements limits matches only to the top-most element in the elements path.
Tests: added missing widget test suite fixtures.
Added a test case ensuring that context's options.widget doesn't trigger inside of a widget editable.
Tests: added unit tests for priorities.
Allow widget definitions to be passed both as a string or an array of strings.
Inline Toolbar context should cache filter instance.

Implemented a basic ACF matching logic.

Now next thing I need to do is to cache filter instance, as it's expensive to build it.
Tests: added missing integration HTML file.
Implementing option.elements, for now only basic tests + stubbed implementation.
Setting up for ACF matching, imported a function to convert DOM element into a style definition.
Tests: improved context manual test a bit.
Added integration to hide the toolbar when editor mode is changed.

Added a test case for hiding inline toolbar when the editor is blurred.

This required me to override ballonpanel.blur method, as currently balloonpanel forces the focus to be moved back to the editor (https://github.com/ckeditor/ckeditor-dev/blob/major/plugins/balloonpanel/plugin.js#L298).
This is undesired here, as it would create an infinite loopback. More details in comments inside of overriden inlineToolbarView.blur method.
Removed unused context methods / tests. Added some API docs, corrected a case where showing toolbar for editor with no selection throws an exception.
Improved the way that element pointed by inline toolbar is determined.
Added a temporary solution for rendering the toolbar.
Tests: minor adjustments to unit tests.
Tests: added a dedicated manual test for Inline Toolbar Context.

Extracted listeners attaching into a separate function, so that it's possible to disable listeners in some unit tests.

It was causing a lot of extra toolbar.show / hide calls, which in turn required me to call toolbar.show.reset() in every TC. That was not an elegant solution, so instead I made it easier to disable.

What's more, I'm thinking about removing it completely from the constructor, and attach only on first show() method. That would be even more performance-friendly solution. And we'll be able to remove these _attachListeners stubs from init functions.

Manual test for bug in IE.

Remove double slash from tableselection.css path

this.path ends with a slash so the final path to tableselection.css contains a double slash. This can prevent the stylesheet from being loaded in some cases (e.g. when it is loaded from within a WebJar and not directly from the file system). Other plugins that use this.path (see a11yhelp, find, image2, link, liststyle, magicline, specialchar, table) don't prefix the path fragments appended to this.path with a slash.

Moved initial selection fix from the constructor to editable.

The reason why we must move this fix is that there‚Äôs no difference between initialising editor and setting data - in both cases the same element is active and anchor is the same. However, we need to force focusing editable in the second case and we cannot do that in the first case.

Fixed editor crash after deleting a table.

This is a fix for a bug.

*Scenario:*
1. Have an inline initialized editor
2. In that editor add a table and ensure that it is the sole element in the editable container (nothing before and nothing after)
3. Use the contextual menu to delete the table
4. The editor is no longer working :(

Note: This can be reproduced also on the demo site: http://ckeditor.com/demo#inline

*The fix:*
Just added a check to not remove the parent element of the table if that parent is the container.

Update style.js to treat blockquotes as objects. Hi, Blockquotes are broken as inline elements and don't work how I'd expect as a block element but the object element category fits perfectly. Once correctly set as an object element, you can have paragraphs inside the blockquote and pressing "enter" creates a new

tag rather than a new

tag. Also, this allows us to define a blockquote level style. This appears to have been a previously identified issue here - http://dev.ckeditor.com/ticket/1009 - and I'm having the exact same problem as mentioned there.

Notify undoManager about changes only when fixDom has done any.
Lock undoManager's snapshots stack when moving selection.
Use class name rather than isVisible to check if toolbar is collapsed.
Fixed: Wrong position of arrows in combo elements (RTL).
Copied the jslint scripts from v3.
Copied DTD test page from v3.
Moved dialog language entries out of the main language file for specialchar.
Moved a11yhelp language entries to the dialogs folder to avoid having them merged on the release version.
Added asset fixing 404 errors for tests.
Renamed some of the magicline config options.
Moved plugin language entries into separate files.
Renamed core language file entries to properly match their plugin counterparts.
Avoid loading the plugin language file if its entries are already available on editor.lang.
Fixed the improper use of .context on the div plugin.
Fixed the object check in isContextFor.
Reverted an incorrect change on the styles combo checks for objects elements.
Removed inappropriate usage of .context for tableProperties.
Added support for object selections on isContextFor.
Fixed the ENTER key behavior for block-less contexts.
Corrected isContextOf to isContextFor (coherent with its documentation).
The .refresh method is not there to indicate that the command is context-sensitive. It is just a way to refresh the command state, being it context sensitive or not (e.g. showblocks).
Moved the global checks into .refresh() otherwise they'll not be performed when calling the method directly.
Refactor the plugins to use the contextual feature.
Proposal for context and contextSensitive properties for commands.
Reverted fix introduced by t/34 for Gecko.
Fixed the new combo styles when the uicolor is used.
Fixed: Keyboard navigation is broken on combos.
Updated all remaining plugins to work with the new namespace system for lang.
Enforcing the plugin namespace into editor.lang. Updated the devtools plugin only for now.
Fixed: Toolbar floating start a bit too late.

Fixed: Maximize is broken in source mode.

* Caused by the obsolete editor.textarea property.

Fixed: Select All button is broken in source mode.

* Caused by the obsolete editor.textarea property.
Preserve IE's conditional comment in Google Closure Compiler (#93).
Wrong path to CSS files were used when timestamp was set.
Corrected copyright headers using the @license tag.
Added CKBuilder directives for sample files
Removed patch for #7588 due to "ERROR - Parse error. invalid return".
Promoted the fix to all non-IE browsers to benefit the editor loading speed.
Fix for Webkit creating new history entry on load of wysiwygare iframe (#34).
Removed compatibility hack with styles and selection plugins.
Provided a basic support for right-to-left languages.

UpdateEditableSize method.

* Commented out command-related stuff.

Introduced shared state object.

* Hardcoded default config values.
* UpdateWindowSize operates on that directly.

Inline editor support.

* Box opacity support.
* Keyboard insertions procedure for inline editors.
* Added white characters into box children to prevent them from being removed.
* Box removal on getData to preserve clean output of an editor.
* Prevent IE from resizing editable areas when the box is being inserted.
* Disabled box insertion while mouse is held.

Timeout-based mouse check (instead of event-based).

* Box edge-styles. FirstDescendantTrigger. Improved vertical search.
* Plugin can put the box between all blocks.
* Command support.
* Scroll event disables the procedure.
* Box icon included.

Keystroke support. Expand trigger totally rebuilded.

* Trigger offset and keystrokes became configurable via CKEDITOR.config.
* Disabled resize and drag'n'drop on box element in IE9.

Use elementFromPoint method

* Trigger filter.
* Show box for focused editor only.

Basic skeleton of the plugin.

* Mouse-related functionality.
Fixed console.log existance check for IEs in clipboard sample.
Fixed: editor.config.width passed incorrectly to the maincontainer template.
Editable#insertXXX - rule 8 implemented - blocks inherit inline styles in text mode.
Refactorization of editable#insertXXX methods - state object introduced.
Editable#insertXXX - rules 4, 5, 6, 7 implemented plus minor improvements in various places.
Support for all enterModes in pasted data processing.

Fixes and improvements for the pasted data processing.

* Plain text EOLs handling.
* Better multiple new line handling in htmlified text unification.
* Bogus <brs> and XHTML handling in htmlified text unification.
* More accurate and secure content type sniffing - specific sniffer for each browser.

Pasted data processing.

* Pasted garbage filtering.
* Htmlified text unification.
* HTML textification.
* Config options (title) for editor.getClipboardData.
* Consistent tabs handling in CKEDITOR.tools.htmlEncode.
* Few more editors and tricks in clipboard sample.

Pasted data processing, events and dialogs redesigned.

* Content types: auto, text, html.
* Content type recognition.
* editor.getClipboardData.
* Paste dialogs and commands updated and cleaned up.
HTML samples - removed BOMs, ported to HTML5.
Fix #8783: handling contenteditable attribute in IE7
Reorganized various event listeners in editable boostraping code.
Removed a reference to the "dir" attribute when we wanted to save the tabindex.
Toolbar separators are now included only when needed.

Revert "Avoid empty toolbar and dangling separators on toolbox."

This reverts commit d1bd2cb6151cc477a7cfc2ae7fe0b19d2b8e6b57.
If language file for a plugin does not exist, CKEditor fails to load.
Parse error. identifier is a reserved word
The "scripts" array defined in CKEDITOR.loader can now be accessed.
Normalize and sort CSS rules using browser.
Move normalizeCssText from style.js to tools.js.
Fix for attributes' lists comparision in dom.element.isIndentical.
New toolbar sample to demonstrate toolbar customization.
The CKEDITOR.addCss style element cleanup was broken on IE.
Made it possible to apply skin styles to floating spaces.
Removed an unnecessary over-optimization from CKEDITOR.ui::space.
Move htmldataprocessor from plugin to the core.
Updated v3 merged paths to the v4 directory structure.
Open paste dialog for rejected security alert while pasting from native context menu or menu bar (for IEs).

Patch for #8691. Stop IE7 crashing when pasting certain content.
Prevent all - synthetically and natively pasted content - before insertion into editor after canceling beforePaste event.
Handle pasting from native context menu and menu bar in IE.
Fixes and clarifications for comments regarding execution flow.
Clipboard playground: content of 2nd editor can be used as copied from MSWord.
Minor style fixes for pastefromword plugin.
Stop firing paste event on editor after canceling beforePaste.
Remove fix for old Safari's bug (which is fixed now).
Minor fix: reuse data object passed to beforePaste in paste event.
Correct event choosen for pasting - pasting from menu bar works now in Fx.
Cleaned up changes on the uicolor plugin.
Removed FF specific hacks that are inside the main files.
Fixed the position of combo labels in FF.
Moved CKEDITOR.addTemplate and CKEDITOR.getTemplate to ckeditor.js.
Made it possible to load skins that are not in the distribution.
Removed a CKEDITOR.skinName check because an undefined CKEDITOR.skinName value is very unlikely to happen.
It is wrong to have uiColor as a property of the CKEDITOR.editor prototype.
Moved CKEDITOR.skinName out of core as there is no default value for it.
Fixed the position of the button labels.
Fix: config.contentsLangDirection initialization moved to wysiwygarea plugin
Correct handling of all cases in dom.node::getIndex (see ticket #2)
dom.comment rewritten without createClass tool so comment nodes can be recognized in node constructor
Return null for non-existing keys in domObject::getCustomData
Fixed handling of falsy values in dom.domObject::removeCustomDate
Adapt the clipboard plugin to inline editing.
Fixed paths because of the latest directory structure reorganization.
Minor fix on selectionmark plugin on editor destroying.
When locked, native selection should become null instead of an empty object.
Prevent plugin code error from breaking the "selectionChange" event.
Return value cancels selectionChange event unintentionally.
Fix backspace key been mistakenly blocked.
Selection cache must be cleared on selection::removeAllRanges.
selection::getType should return NONE when there's no actual range available.
selection::getSelectedText should be able to retrieve the text even when the selection is of element type, e.g. full list/table selection.

Revert the "shared toolbox feature" which broke editor in the following cases:
1. Rich combo application.
2. Toolbar keyboard navigation.
Fix a minor bug in "selectionmark" plugin.
Fix fix body logic would invalidate the locked selection.
Remove the ‚Äúwysiwygarea‚Äù plugin requirement from themed creator.
Make undo manager work with editable.
Eliminate the "forceExpand" param of range selection.
Fix a bug which make editor destroy panic.
Fix a bug which causes editor.focus to be async.
Define wysiwygarea as required for themed creator.
Introduce the "selectionmark" which fakes DOM selection it make selection range still visible when editable is blurred.
We should still make the editor "active" when actual DOM focus has moved from editable to other editor UIs, e.g. dialog and panel.
inline editable must also utilize the html data processor.
Range and elementpath are now constrained to editable.
Make it possible to apply styles on locked editor selection.
Make selectRanges works even when selection is locked.

Introduce context aware dom selection for non-framed environment.
1. CKEDITOR.dom.selection constructor now receieve either a
document or an editable element.
2. Automatically lock editor selection upon editable blurry and restore it upon focus
gaining, so editor selection could be used even when native selection is not available.
Remove the possibility of overriding privates. It is conceptually wrong and not used by the code.
Made the editable.setup() method public so it can be used by plugins.
Simplified the sourcearea code to avoid code duplication.
Further simplify the structure of editable classes.
Make editor::updateElement available for replace creation mode only.
More generic argument type for the inline creator.
Remove dirty hacks from v3 while turns out to be outdated supported by tt #3593 and #6153.
Editor constructor should return the instance immediately before loading the rest of stuff (to make all events registration possible).
Code structure re-organization (no code line change);

Use editable class to replace the "editingblock" concept.

1. Enlarge the responsibility of the editable class, making it really handles most of the editing related activities.
2. Made "areas" independent by sub-classing from CKEDITOR.editable.
3. Remove the editing block concept, made "modes switching" logic out of core.
4. Make the "wysiwygarea" plugin optional.
Check list command states even selection change is not fired.
Make dom.node::isReadOnly works for offline element.
More generic type of argument "element" on CKEDITOR.replace.
Creator should no longer concern of an unloaded core, creator function should return the instance immediately.
Fix incorrect function scope in FF.
Move creators from plugin to core.
Fixing bug in boostrap code that prevents editor from loading in Webkit.

Small fix: form attaching moved out of theme loading.

The main UI is now loaded by using local templates.

The editor will now automatically register the keyhandler.

Load the style.js file by default now.

The CKEDITOR.event.on() method will now return an object that can be used to remove the listener.
